title: How to Prepare Spicy Potato Bhaji

steps.headline: Peel potatoes and boil them in a vessel full of water.
steps.description: Add a few pieces of  chicken or vegetable stock.

steps.headline: When the potatoes are soft enough, drain and keep aside.
steps.description: Don't throw the water. Store it in a large bowl.

steps.headline: Sprinkle some cumin seeds,mustard seeds and curry leaves.
When the cumin starts turning brown, add the  onions, green chillies and few spoons of ginger-garlic paste and sauté well.
When the onions have turned soft and brown, add the tomatoes and sauté well.
Add the spices and stir well.
Add the water used to boil the potatoes just enough to make the mixture thick.
steps.description: Keep stirring the mixture for few minutes.

steps.headline: Add the boiled potatoes.
steps.description: Sprinkle salt as required and mix well.

steps.headline: Sprinkle a few coriander leaves on top.
Serve with bread sticks or Chapathi.

text: Peel potatoes and boil them in a vessel full of water. Add a few pieces of  chicken or vegetable stock. When the potatoes are soft enough, drain and keep aside. Don't throw the water. Store it in a large bowl. Add oil/butter in another vessel.  Sprinkle some cumin seeds,mustard seeds and curry leaves.  When the cumin starts turning brown, add the  onions, green chillies and few spoons of ginger-garlic paste and sauté well.  When the onions have turned soft and brown, add the tomatoes and sauté well.  Add the spices and stir well.  Add the water used to boil the potatoes just enough to make the mixture thick. Keep stirring the mixture for few minutes. Add the boiled potatoes. Sprinkle salt as required and mix well. Sprinkle a few coriander leaves on top.  Serve with bread sticks or Chapathi.
